basics.name: Souvik Maji
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Hard-working and self-motivated senior backend engineer with a strong commitment to collaboration and solutions oriented problem-solving. Experienced in Design and Development of End to End solutions using Restful APIs and Micro-services.

work.summary: Senior Backend Engineer in the fleet experience team
Senior Backend Engineer at the cross border engineering team taking care of international payments at Razorpay
highlights: Collaborated on developing and managing the platform to support all international payments done through the Razorpay payment gateway.
Contributed to the design and implementation of international recurring payments
Led the backend development efforts for the implementation of a B2B export payment transfer system, supporting large ticket transactions.
Actively involved in designing a new microservice to handle International PSP integrations.

work.summary: Backend Java Developer for various gaming products of Junglee Games - the fastest growing skill games company.
highlights: Created a service for auto KYC verification of users, utilizing a fuzzy name matching logic.
Implemented a rule engine to calculate cashback bonuses based on human-readable rules.
Developed the backend for an internal admin server.
Successfully optimized query performance for critical time-consuming SQL operations, resulting in a significant improvement of up to 33%.
Designed and implemented a scalable solution to display live scores for sports matches in the Howzat app.

work.summary: Working as a Product Engineer in Paypermint - the next generation trusted payments platform engineered to power online businesses.
highlights: Engaged in all stages of the Product Development Lifecycle, from understanding the Business Case to Implementation.
Extensively worked with Microservice Architecture, utilizing SQL & NoSQL databases, and employing GRPC as the communication protocol.
Designed and Implemented Paypermint's Invoicing and Subscription solution.
Led the effort to migrate a legacy web application to Spring Web MVC, incorporating a Bootstrap dashboard theme.
Developed and maintained Restful APIs and Open Source API Wrapper Libraries in various languages, including Java, Python, Go, NodeJs, as well as mobile SDKs like Android and Cordova.
Created multiple Single Page Web Applications to support complex application workflows.
Experience in collaborating with 3rd party vendors and clients, providing and supporting technical solutions.

projects.name: Rural Health Care Monitoring System
projects.description: Implemented a load balancing service to balance load in a wireless sensor network which is used to receive medical data from rural health care centres. Developed a web-based dashboard to be used by doctors to monitor patient data. Created a Medicine Reminder System.

projects.name: Bengali OCR
projects.description: Statistical language modelling of Bengali text to design a handwritten Bengali character recognition system.

projects.name: Foodcache
projects.description: Express based Web Application to keep track of money paid and received for office pantry. It gives monthly alerts to all its users via email and slack. The admin of this application can handle accounts and can view which users still owe money.

projects.name: Leaderboard
projects.description: Golang web application with a RESTful interface for managing game leaderboards. Benchmarked leaderboard calculation time for Redis vs PostgreSql database. Developed a single page JQuery Datatables based UI.

projects.name: Hobbit
projects.description: Static site generator written in Golang which uses git as a backend. Inspired from https://github.com/gollum/gollum

projects.name: Got-Bot
projects.description: Twitter bot that can post random content (media/text) from a particular subreddit.

projects.name: VBM - Virtual Brainfucking Machine
projects.description: VBM is a simple yet fast brainfuck interpreter.

projects.name: Cross The Road
projects.description: Arcade style game developed in JavaScript. Inspired from Frogger

volunteer.summary: Student body organisation to inform, discuss and further students knowledge of Linux based operating systems, Free Open Source Softwares and Tools
